content:
Hello everyone,

In order to collaborate with the translation, I've created a spreadsheet of the answers (61 pt-br yaaay) on the shared Drive folder.

One tab is the original response, and the other is the EN translated version. I'll likely move column-by-column and mark as green when it has been translated - but feel free to revisit and correct the translations.

I had some focus time today - and I got the translation finished already.

Feel free to review it tho :)
I got an access request from @Erich Gubler -- I'm just checking because I didn't recognize the name. @Erich Gubler are you looking to help out with portuguese survey results?
@nikomatsakis: I'd love to help with Brazilian Portuguese! I'm assuming @Bruno Tavares is the same individual whom I've worked with before on translating one of their presentations before.
Just tell me what to do and I'll see what my capacity for it is like. :)
@Bruno Tavares: Since you've already finished, just want to make sure: you still want review of your translation?

I've reviewed the translation, but most suggestions I've kept as comments so far. I couldn't suppress my inner professor and add lots of thoughts about feedback into translational decisions. If nobody responds in the next few days, I'll apply my own suggestions and keep the previous revisions in comment, so discussion can be had later (if ever).
We're shooting for everything being done by the 12th, IIUC? @Ryan Levick

@Erich Gubler Thank you so much! I was offline for the last few days and I've missed the messages.

I appreciate all the feedback and translation suggestions applied. I've revisited them now as I've noticed the date (and the missed emails).

I personally appreciate having the reasoning of the suggestions on the comment - I got to learn a couple of things from it :)

Most of @Erich Gubler's suggestions were applied already - and 3 comments left to be resolved. Anyway - I think that it should be fine to use the data as is even if we don't clear those up until @Ryan Levick and @nikomatsakis copy the data
@Bruno Tavares: Yay, that's exactly what I was hoping for! :) I'm excited to get to the unresolved comments.
